commit message: Adding a basic release info screen
Add full name support for authors on the release info screen

Now loading release metadata

It only loads the license so far, but it's a start.
Scripts for messing with modules related to a release
Adding module list to the release view
Making the module list on the release view clickable
Make it so we can get POD from more .pod files
Make result sets sortable, sort the modules for release list

Basic fixes to get the release view operational for tablets

It's not using the view pane yet as it should.
Make use of the two-pane panel viewer for showing POD on the view screen
Making the sidebar wider, adding an icon to the release view module list
Allow abstracts to be multiline on simplified items

On tablets, show the module you were looking at on the previous screen

Also makes the release header a pretty color.

Also show the current module as selected in the list

...when jumping to a release view
Remove some duplicated code handling web view clicks

Make is so that the pod viewer for the release sticks to modules for this release

If you click on a link to another release, it will take you to a new view
showing that release!

Fix a little bug introduced a couple commits back

Make sure we strip off the write prefix. Oops.
Fix wierd blackening items when scrolling
Adding the search box to the release view screen
Don't handle our own configuration changes

Replace the SCHWERN sample info with 'Loading...'

Sometimes it appears briefly and that's... awkward.
Load more items when in portrait mode
Use 300dp for the width in portrait mode
Fix a couple of phone bugs caused by tablet improvements
Layout improvements for small screens of the release view
releng: bumping versions to vc15 v0.5.0
releng: Updated README and change log
Adding an about dialog
Added the sign in menu and the account picker
Fix the About dialog on small screens
Fix CPAN Sidekick to cope with changes to the CPAN API
releng: version bump

Disable sign in, which is not complete

(Shouldn't be in master at all yet. Oops.)
